meanings.definition: An attractive or exciting quality that makes someone or something appealing
meanings.sent1: The movie star had a special glamour that captivated everyone.
meanings.sent2: The fashion show was full of glamour and elegance.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics added a touch of glamour to the family's daily routine.
meanings.sent4: The old castle was filled with a mysterious glamour that drew visitors from far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering lights of the city at night had a magical glamour that was hard to resist.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem more attractive or exciting
meanings.sent1: She used makeup to glamour up her look for the party.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team worked hard to glamour the new product in the commercial.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to glamour the audience with his tricks, but they saw through his illusions.
meanings.sent4: The artist used vibrant colors to glamour the painting and make it stand out.
meanings.sent5: The chef knew how to glamour the dish with just the right presentation.

meanings.definition: A magical or enchanting spell or charm
meanings.sent1: The fairy cast a glamour over the forest to protect it from harm.
meanings.sent2: The wizard's book contained powerful glamours that could change reality.
meanings.sent3: The children believed in the old legend of a hidden glamour that granted wishes.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious woman wore a necklace with a hidden glamour that granted her eternal youth.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tome was said to hold the most potent glamours known to mankind.
